sect3.title: User Menus
sect3.para: This is a list of all the User menus. Most users menus don't change anything about how the inverter operates but the time of day setting, and the generator timers. Most of these menues are informational

sect4.title: Inverter Mode
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.literallayout: Set Inverter OFF SRCH ON CHG

entry.para: This sets the inverter mode. Off is self explanatory. Search mode puts the inverter in a power-saving mode, and only comes out when the load is over the search limit. (usually 16 watts)

entry.literallayout: CHG avail. only in FLT mode.
to move cursor. Move cursor to

sect4.title: Generator Mode
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.literallayout: Set Generator OFF AUTO ON EQ

entry.para: This sets the generator mode. Auto is for Auto Start, and EQ is for equalizing batteries.

entry.literallayout: Move cursor to GEN OFF to reset
If no start in 6 trys then error.
If Gen starts & runs for 5 min

sect4.title: Trace Engineering
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: This sets the generator mode. Auto is for Auto Start, and EQ is for equalizing batteries.

sect4.title: Meters
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: The amount of current the inverter (or when it's in charging mode) is putting out.
The amount of current that the inverter is receiving from a power source, like the generator.
This is the amount of current that is being used by AC devices.
This is the actual voltage in DC of the battery bank.
This is the temperature compensation voltage in DC.
This is the AC output voltage of the interter.
This is the AC input voltage of the power grid (assuming you have a grid intertie system).
This is the AC input voltage from the generator.
This is the frequency in Hertz of the inverter. In the US, this should be around 60.

entry.literallayout: AC1 & AC2 volts valid only when
Batt volt actual is used for
Batt volt temp comp is used for

sect4.title: Error Causes
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: This is ON when the inverter is putting out too much current
This is on when the inverters transformer is too hot.
This is ON when the heat sink is too hot.
This is ON when the batteries are over voltage.
This is ON when the batteries are low.
This is ON when you have a wiring problem.
This is ON when there is an error in stacked inverters.
This is ON when there is an error in starting the generator.
If this is ON, there is a power problem with your generator.
This is ON when the generator is over or under speed.

sect4.title: Time of Day
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: This sets the hours part of the current time.
This sets the hours part of the current time.
This sets the seconds part of the current time.

sect4.title: Generator Timer
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: This is the the start of the time period when the when your generator won't be started automatically.
This is the the end of the time period when your generator won't be started automatically.

entry.literallayout: time unless batt volts is less
To defeat timers set start = end
If exercise days set to 1 then

sect4.title: END USER MENU
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: This means you are at the end of the user menus. Inverter Setup must be pressed to get to the Setup menu.

sect3.title: Setup Menus
sect3.para: This is a list of all the setup menus. Unlike the user menus, you should know what you are doing before you change any of these values. If something goes wrong, reset your inverter to the factory defaults.

sect4.title: Inverter Setup
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.literallayout: Set Grid Usage FLT SELL SLT LBX
Set Low battery cut out VDC

entry.para: This sets the low battery cut out voltage.

entry.literallayout: Set Low battery cut in VDC

entry.para: This sets the low battery cut in voltage.

entry.literallayout: Set High battery cut out VDC

entry.para: This sets the high battery cut out voltage.
This sets the wattage that determines when the inverter comes out of search mode, and turns on.
This sets the search watts increment/decrement increment, which must be a multiple of 16.

sect4.title: Battery Charging
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: This is the amount one must reach before selling power.
This sets the maximum charging current.
This ets the type of the battery, so temperature compensation works.

sect4.title: AC Inputs
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: This sets the Grid current input.
This sets tge generator current input.
This sets the lower input voltage.
This sets the upper input voltage.

entry.literallayout: In SELL mode AC1 input VAC limits

sect4.title: Gen Auto Start setup
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: This sets the voltage for when the generator should come on to help with a high load.
This sets the delay in fractions of a minute for the generator to delay when starting.
This sets the delay in fractions of a minute for the generator to delay when stopping.

sect4.title: Gen starting details
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

sect4.title: Auxilary Relays R9 R10 R1
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: Set the voltage for when relay 9 should turn on.
Set the hysteresis level for relay 9.
Set the voltage for when relay 9 should turn on.
Set the hysteresis level for relay 9.
Set the voltage for when relay 9 should turn on.
Set the hysteresis level for relay 9.

sect4.title: Bulk Charge Trigger Timer
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.literallayout: If grid timer active set bulk
In SLT mode dont disable this
timer. It is the daily chg time.

sect4.title: Low Battery Transfer (LBX)
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.literallayout: Set Low battery cut in VDC
See menu 9 to enable LBX mode
Make sure LBX is above LBCO volts

sect4.title: Battery Selling
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.literallayout: See menu 9 to enable SELL mode

sect4.title: Grid Usage Timer
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: Set the start time for charging the batteries.
Set the time to stop charging the batteries.

entry.literallayout: SELL mode sells battery to AC1
FLT mode drops AC1 and inverts
Sell and float modes use timer.
SLT and LBX mode ignore timer.

sect4.title: Grid Usage Timer
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.literallayout: modes only. Goes back to battery
For LBX mode set float&bulk volts
cycle batteries up and down and

sect4.title: END SETUP MENU
sect4.para: These are the messages as displayed by the inverter:

entry.para: You are at the end of the setup menu items, and have to press menu heading down top continue.
